titleStmt.title: E. R. Cook et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9643

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Hopkinsville Ky
To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioners would recommend the case of Taylor & West fined in two cases for keeping a tipling house, in the sum of One hundred & fifty Dollars each as one worthy the interposition of the Executive power vested in you and ask the remission of said fines

E R Cook
, F, Brown
W R Payne
Jas F Buckner
E, M, Buckner
C. T. Ratcliffe
Geo W Ratcliffe
W D McComb
J J McComb
F. P. Stuart
Wm D Gentry
J. M. Wilson
Jo McCarroll
H, A, Phelps
B. H. Bristow
G A Champlin
J. B. Gowen

Christian Cir. ct.
2 Judgt each $150
Taylor & West
Respd 12 Mos
Issd Nov 22d 1860
